channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 拉丁美洲的监狱已成为帮派的庇护所和招募中心，这些帮派对囚犯不受限制地行使权力，为他们提供保护或食物等基本物品以换取金钱。
item.description:
Las prisiones latinoamericanas se han convertido en refugios y centros de reclutamiento de bandas que ejercen una autoridad irrestricta sobre los presos, a quienes brindan protección o artículos básicos, como comida, a cambio de dinero. https://t.co/ADz8HNoOvd

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 以色列在加沙地带持续开展的军事行动正面临着谴责浪潮，甚至其最坚定的盟友美国的支持也受到了考验
item.description:
Israel’s ongoing military operation in the Gaza Strip is facing a wave of condemnation that is testing the support of even its staunchest ally, the United States https://t.co/Cv2iGgHnj6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 国际刑警组织是世界上最大的警察组织。但它也是独裁者和专制者用来对付政敌的新式武器。以下是国际刑警组织被用作骚扰工具的四种方式。
item.description:
Interpol es la mayor organización policial del mundo. Pero también es un arma novedosa que dictadores y autócratas usan contra sus enemigos políticos. He aquí cuatro formas en que se ha utilizado a la Interpol como instrumento de acoso. https://t.co/144DAnFjqw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 几乎没有人听过以色列提议的欧洲电视网歌曲 "十月雨"。但一些社交媒体用户将这首歌解释为对 10 月 7 日哈马斯袭击事件的引用，并认为这首歌对于歌曲比赛来说过于政治化。
item.description:
Almost nobody has heard Israel’s proposed Eurovision song, “October Rain.” But some social media users are interpreting it as a reference to the Hamas attacks of Oct. 7 and say it’s too political for the song contest. https://t.co/8wmTV90lzs

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯最著名的反对派领袖的妻子尤利娅-纳瓦尔娜亚长期以来一直回避聚光灯，但他在狱中的死亡可能会让她无法回避。"她说："我没有权利放弃。
item.description:
Yulia Navalnaya, la esposa del líder opositor más famoso de Rusia, rehuyó durante mucho tiempo los reflectores, pero la muerte de él en prisión puede hacer que eso sea imposible. “No tengo derecho a rendirme”, dijo. https://t.co/VBPGFm2szO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 尼克劳斯-维斯（Niklaus Wirth）去世，享年 89 岁。他创造了帕斯卡尔语言（Pascal），这种编程语言在个人计算机的早期使用，是当时其他语言的简单替代品。
item.description:
Niklaus Wirth, who created Pascal, a programming language used in the early days of personal computing that was a simpler alternative to other languages of the day, has died at 89. https://t.co/HNTT0W2TtA

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 曾几何时，美国人的起居室里充斥着塑料、梦幻、充满乐观主义色彩的未来主义家具，令人欢欣鼓舞。查尔斯-斯坦迪格（Charles Stendig）是一位进口商，他参与了其中的许多工作。他已经去世，享年 99 岁。
item.description: There was a time when the American living room went cheerfully haywire with futuristic furniture that was plastic and fantastic and brimming with optimism. Charles Stendig, an importer, had a hand in much of it. He has died at 99. nyti.ms/3OQXuLV

item.title: 极端民族主义博客作者安德烈-莫罗佐夫（Andrei Morozov）描述了在他报道了俄罗斯在阿夫迪夫卡战役中的军事损失后，有人对他进行恐吓，并威胁要结束他自己的生命。
item.description: The ultranationalist blogger, Andrei Morozov, described a campaign of intimidation against him after he reported on Russian military losses in the battle for Avdiivka, and threatened to end his own life. nyti.ms/3T5Bm2D

item.title: 吉姆-拉特克利夫（Jim Ratcliffe）斥资 15 亿美元入股曼联，买下了一个奇怪的安排，即新的少数股权所有者将接管俱乐部足球运营的日常控制权。他说，解决这个问题并不容易。也不会很快。
item.description: Jim Ratcliffe’s $1.5 billion investment in Manchester United bought a curious arrangement in which the new minority owner would take over day-to-day control of the club’s soccer operation. Fixing it, he said, won’t be easy. Or fast. nyti.ms/48vSFyq

item.title: 美国和欧洲一直在推动建立一条新的管道，从克罗地亚而不是俄罗斯向波斯尼亚输送天然气，旨在削弱莫斯科在该地区的影响力。但由于巴尔干国家各民族之间的分歧，该项目一直停滞不前。
item.description: The United States and Europe have pushed a new pipeline to bring gas to Bosnia from Croatia rather than from Russia, aiming to dilute Moscow’s influence in the region. But the project has been stalled by divisions among the Balkan country’s ethnic groups. nyti.ms/3whY0Mj

item.title: 据科技业内人士和顶尖工程师称，中国目前在人工智能生成方面落后美国至少一年，而且可能会进一步落后，这为残酷的技术竞争进入新阶段创造了条件。
item.description: China now trails the U.S. in generative AI by at least a year and may be falling further behind, according to tech industry insiders and leading engineers, setting the stage for a new phase in the cutthroat technological competition. nyti.ms/3SRpX5p

item.title: 当一艘停靠着的载有 19000 头奶牛的轮船散发出铺天盖地的恶臭飘荡在开普敦上空时，一位当地人说："如果这是一部动画片，那一定是绿色的"
item.description: As the overwhelmingly foul smell from a docked ship carrying 19,000 cows wafted over Cape Town, one local observed: “It would have been green if this were a cartoon.” nyti.ms/49ocGbB

item.title: 吉姆-拉特克利夫花费 15 亿美元购买了曼联 25% 的股份。本周三，他提出了自己的修复愿景。
item.description: Jim Ratcliffe spent $1.5 billion for a 25 percent stake in Manchester United. On Wednesday, he laid out his vision for fixing it. nyti.ms/48tm2Bv

item.title: 爆炸性新闻：美国官员花了数年时间调查贩毒集团与墨西哥总统盟友之间可能存在的联系，当时墨西哥总统已经在治理该国。
item.description: Último momento: Funcionarios de EE. UU. pasaron años indagando posibles vínculos entre los cárteles de la droga y aliados del presidente de México cuando él ya gobernaba el país. nyti.ms/42OItjg

item.title: 纳瓦尔尼先生的母亲和女发言人周四表示，俄罗斯当局已宣布反对派领导人阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼（Aleksei A. Navalny）死于自然原因，但在其母亲同意举行 "秘密葬礼 "之前拒绝公布其遗体。
item.description: Russian authorities have declared that the opposition leader Aleksei A. Navalny died of natural causes but are refusing to release his remains until his mother agrees to a “secret funeral,” Mr. Navalny’s mother and his spokeswoman said on Thursday. nyti.ms/3Pg52In

item.title: 爆炸性新闻：美国官员花了数年时间调查墨西哥总统在任期间贩毒集团与总统盟友之间的潜在联系。
item.description: Breaking News: U.S. officials spent years looking into potential links between drug cartels and allies of Mexico’s president while he was in office. nyti.ms/3T8rDIY

item.title: 弗拉基米尔-普京总统周四乘坐一架超音速轰炸机进行了短途飞行，这是他在大选前为在俄罗斯国内展示自信和力量所做努力的一部分，同时也是在向西方提醒俄罗斯的核能力。
item.description: President Vladimir Putin on Thursday took a short flight on a supersonic bomber, part of his pre-election effort to project confidence and power inside Russia, and a conspicuous reminder to the West of his country’s nuclear capabilities. nyti.ms/3SMNvYX

item.title: 在巴黎准备举办夏季奥运会和残奥会之际，埃菲尔铁塔工人长达数日的罢工引发了人们对一场旷日持久、引人注目的劳资纠纷的担忧。
item.description: A dayslong strike by Eiffel Tower workers raises worries of a protracted and highly visible labor dispute as Paris prepares to host the Summer Olympics and Paralympics. nyti.ms/4bFXRmh

item.title: 英国希望有更多的核电站来帮助应对气候变化，但拖延和成本飙升使这一努力变得更加复杂。
item.description: Britain wants more nuclear plants to help tackle climate change, but delays and soaring costs are complicating the effort. nyti.ms/49rvIxQ

item.title: 美国和欧洲一直倡导修建一条新的输气管道，将天然气输送到波斯尼亚，切断俄罗斯的天然气供应。但该项目因各民族间的争斗而停滞不前。
item.description: The United States and Europe have championed a new pipeline to bring gas to Bosnia and cut supplies from Russia. But the project has been stalled by feuding among ethnic groups. nyti.ms/4bP3FKm

item.title: 来访的美国议员试图向台湾保证，面对中国的压力，美国将与台湾站在一起，同时警告说，乌克兰援助提案的不确定性可能会削弱美国阻止北京对台湾采取侵略行动的努力。
item.description: Visiting U.S. lawmakers sought to assure Taiwan that the U.S. would stand by it in the face of pressure from China, while warning that uncertainty over proposed Ukraine aid could weaken U.S. efforts to deter Beijing from moving aggressively against Taiwan. nyti.ms/4bJkRAK

item.title: 在著名流行病学家模拟的三种情况中，加沙战争的升级可能导致未来六个月内有 85 000 名巴勒斯坦人因受伤和疾病死亡。
item.description: An escalation of the war in Gaza could lead to the deaths of 85,000 Palestinians from injuries and disease over the next six months, in the worst of three situations that prominent epidemiologists have modeled. nyti.ms/48pVAIU

item.title: 中国南部制造业中心广州的一座桥梁在一艘集装箱船撞上后部分坍塌，当地政府称，车辆坠落造成至少两人死亡。
item.description: Part of a bridge in the southern Chinese manufacturing hub of Guangzhou collapsed after a container ship crashed into it, killing at least two people as vehicles plummeted, the local authorities said. nyti.ms/4bIFQ6L

item.title: 军方官员和专家说，俄罗斯军队最近几天在乌克兰南部村庄罗博蒂涅周围发动了多次袭击，目标是乌克兰在去年夏天的反攻中罕见地成功赢得的土地。
item.description: Russian forces in recent days have launched multiple attacks around the southern Ukrainian village of Robotyne, military officials and experts said, targeting land hard-won by Ukraine in a rare success of its counteroffensive last summer. nyti.ms/42Qn6hM

item.title: 日本股市创下历史新高，超过了 1989 年日本经济巅峰时期的水平。
item.description: Stocks in Japan hit a record high, surpassing a level last seen in 1989 at the peak of the country’s economic ascendancy. nyti.ms/3SMqtl2

item.title: 本周，开普敦上空飘来一股恶臭，当地人称其 "难以想象"。
item.description: When a smell so foul that locals called it “unimaginable” wafted over Cape Town this week, a search for the source of the stench choking the scenic South African tourist destination led to the city’s harbor. nyti.ms/49n4UyG

item.title: "我不想成为一名战地摄影记者"。巴勒斯坦摄影师莫塔兹-阿扎伊扎（Motaz Azaiza）记录了加沙战争爆发以来的苦难。因此，他吸引了数以百万计的追随者--在报道战争的同时，他也努力在战争中生存下来。
item.description: “I didn’t want to be a war photojournalist.” Motaz Azaiza, a Palestinian photographer, has documented Gaza’s suffering since the war there began. In doing so, he attracted millions of followers — covering the war while also trying to survive it. nyti.ms/3OT8vfI

item.title: 新闻分析：巴基斯坦人曾一度认为军方是控制国家政治的铁腕。这一幻想已被打破，从而造成了建制派迄今为止最大的危机之一。
item.description: News Analysis: Pakistanis once thought of the military as the iron hand controlling the country’s politics. That illusion has been broken, creating one of the establishment’s biggest crises yet. nyti.ms/3I4O7UW

item.title: 太平洋小岛纽埃 20 多年来一直在为夺回 .nu 域名而斗争，纽埃称该域名有助于确保其财政未来。这场争端终于接近尾声。
item.description: The small Pacific island of Niue has been fighting for more than 20 years to reclaim the .nu domain, which it says could help secure its financial future. The dispute is finally nearing a conclusion. nyti.ms/49mQONB

item.title: 多年来，强人和专制者利用国际刑警组织这个世界上最大的警察组织，跨越国界抓捕他们的政敌。随着国际刑警组织的不断完善，他们开始寻找新的方法来滥用国际刑警组织。
item.description: For years, strongmen and autocrats used Interpol, the world’s largest police organization, to reach across borders and grab their political enemies. As the agency made fixes, they have turned to new ways to misuse Interpol. nyti.ms/49Gn4Lr
